      • quotedCommaSplit

      • permissiveQuotedCommaSplit

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> permissiveQuotedCommaSplit(java.lang.String input)
        Permissive version of quotedCommaSplit that prints warnings instead of throwing exceptions in certain cases that don't adhere to the spec but are recoverable.

      • concatAndJoin

        public static java.lang.String concatAndJoin(java.lang.String sep,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> data,
                             java.lang.String prefix,
                             java.lang.String suffix)
        Concat a prefix and suffix to each element in a list, and join with a separator. For example, turn the list a b c into {a};{b};{c} Equivalent to the following groovy code: 
        data.collect{ prefix + it + suffix }.join(sep)
        Parameters:
        sep - separator between list elements
        data - list of strings
        prefix - prefix concatenated before each element in the list
        suffix - suffix concatenated after each element in the list

      • safeParseDouble

        public static java.lang.Double safeParseDouble(java.lang.String val)
        May return null, but will not throw an exception

      • safeParseInt

        public static java.lang.Integer safeParseInt(java.lang.String val)

      • join

        public static void join(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
        java.lang.String sep,
        java.util.Collection<?> values)
        Join collection into and append to a StringBuilder, with a separator between. Useful if you want to join strings and append to an existing StringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        builder - StringBuilder you want to append to. This variable will be modified.
        sep - Separator between strings
        values - collection of strings to join.

      • join

        public static <T> void join(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
            java.lang.String sep,
            T... values)
        Join an multi value list into a single string, with a separator between.

        Join an multi value list into a single string, with a separator between.

      • removeOptionalQuotes

        public static java.lang.String removeOptionalQuotes(java.lang.String in)
        If input string starts with a quote character (") AND ends with the same quote character, both a removed. Otherwise the input is returned unchanged.

        public static boolean emptyOrNull(java.lang.String s)
